Package provided.discovery

Interface IDiscoveryManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote, java.io.Serializable
    public interface IDiscoveryManager
extends java.rmi.Remote, java.io.Serializable
    Top-level entity that can obtain IDiscoveryServers to monitor the available registered end points (IEndPointData) of a given category on the remote discovery server, or to obtain IRegisteredDiscoveryServers in response to registering an end point with the remote discovery server. IRegisteredDiscoveryServers are IDiscoveryServers that are associated with the registered end point and are responsible for maintaining the "heart beat" that tells the remote discovery server that the registered end point is still valid.

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      IDiscoveryServer connectAs​(java.lang.String category)
      Gets an IDiscoveryServer associated with the given category name.
      IRegisteredDiscoveryServer register​(java.lang.String friendlyName, java.lang.String category, java.lang.String boundName)
      Registers the existence of an RMI stub bound a name in the local registry.
      void start​(IRMIUtils rmiUtils)
      Starts the discovery manager on the current machine.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start​(IRMIUtils rmiUtils)
        Starts the discovery manager on the current machine. The discovery manager MUST be started before it can be used! The IDiscoveryConnection.getDiscoveryManager() and .getDiscoveryManagerAt() methods will automatically start the IDiscoveryManager instance before returning it, so in general, no specific actions are needed by the utilizing application to start its IDiscoveryManager instances.
        Parameters:
        rmiUtils - The local instance of IRMIUtils

      • register

        IRegisteredDiscoveryServer register​(java.lang.String friendlyName,
                                    java.lang.String category,
                                    java.lang.String boundName)
                             throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Registers the existence of an RMI stub bound a name in the local registry. This information is called an "end point". An IRegisteredDiscoveryServer associated wtih the registered end point is returned. A friendly name is supplied for users of the discovery server to see instead of the bound name. A category name is supplied to isolate sets of end points from each other. The Registry port on the local machine is assumed to be IRMI_Defs.REGISTRY_PORT.
        Parameters:
        friendlyName - The friendly name to be associated with this end point.
        category - The grouping category for this end point (case sensitive!).
        boundName - The bound name associated with this end point.
        Returns:
        An IRegisteredDiscoveryServer instance that is tied to the given end point, particularly its category.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - In the event of a communications error with the remote discovery server machine.

      • connectAs

        IDiscoveryServer connectAs​(java.lang.String category)
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
        Gets an IDiscoveryServer associated with the given category name.
        Parameters:
        category - A category name (case sensitive!)
        Returns:
        An IDiscoveryServer instance tied to the given category
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - In the event of a communications error with the remote discovery server machine.
